alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Coastal; Mobile Coastal (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued August 29 at 4:18AM CDT until September 01 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... ...HIGH SURF WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM WEDNESDAY TO 1 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents expected. For the High Surf Warning, dangerously large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet expected in the surf zone. * WHERE...In Alabama, Mobile Coastal and Baldwin Coastal Counties. In Florida, Escambia Coastal, Santa Rosa Coastal and Okaloosa Coastal Counties. * WHEN...For the High Rip Current Risk, from this evening through late Thursday night. For the High Surf Warning, from 1 AM Wednesday to 1 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Breaking waves can sweep people off jetties and docks, and into dangerous seas. Life-threatening swimming conditions and significant beach erosion can be expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Everyone should remain out of the water due to life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
